oai_dc:dc.dc:title: DESIGN OF A COASTAL PROTECTION SCHEME FOR ADA AT THE VOLTA-RIVER MOUTH (GHANA)
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Bollen, Mark
Trouw, Koen
Lerouge, Frederik
Gruwez, Vincent
Bolle, Annelies
Hoffman, Bernhard
Leysen, Gert
De Kesel, Yann
Mercelis, Peter
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: coastal erosion
protection schemes
environmental monitoring
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The coastal town Ada in Ghana is threaded by a severe coastal erosion. A protection scheme has to be designed to protect the town. Since the area is ecologically important, e.a. due to the presence of turtles, both during the design process and during the construction phase actions to diminish possible negative effects have to be considered. The design is supported by measuring campaigns and numerical modeling of the currents, waves and morphology
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 32 (2010): Proceedings of 32nd Conference on Coastal Engineering, Shanghai, China, 2010.; management.36
